item.title: The legal status and impact of the UK/EU renegotiation deal.
item.description: Is the UK’s renegotiated EU membership deal legally binding? Steve Peers explores whether the UK’s renegotiated EU membership deal is legally binding and what implications this has. He examines various aspects of the deal, including its legal status, enforceability, and potential for reversibility. Legal Complexity and Forms The renegotiation deal is comprised of seven legal documents: a Decision by EU Heads of State and Government, a Statement by the same group (including a draft Council Decision), a European Council Declaration, and four Commission declarations.
